haf life

I Love the entire Half~Life series!.. Great 1st person Shooter Game Play with a strong Story line...  Opposing Force is a spin off of the original Half~Life where you play through the same event only as a lost, uninformed Soldier sent to contain the situation. If you have not played any of the Half~Life games I recommend you start with the Original Half~Life and follow the Game series plot line from the start.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is well worth the 4.99 you're spending. Opposing Force is a great expansion to Half Life 1. It takes a different approch on the Half Life series. By making you a soldier for the United States Marines by the name of Adrian Shepard. You have been detached to the Black Mesa research facilty to rescue the scientists and deal with the alien problem. Though not everything goes as planed. When the government sends a strike team to kill everyone at Black mesa including you and your fellow marines. The story is very compeling in this game really wanted to know what the hell was going on and why this was happening and as you discover more things about the story it makes it even more enjoyable. The gameplay is great to it is basicly the same as Half Life 1 so it's pretty good on it's own right. There are less puzzles so if you liked Half Life but got sick of puzzles you should get this. Another good factor of the game is it's weapon varitey, and holy shit there are so many like the Barnicle gun being my personal favorite. One more thing that made this game excellent was it's length, for an  expansion its long it could very well be a hole other game which is good so you get more for what you payed for. Unlike other Half Life expansions such as blue shift, you get a good game but it feels very short and could have had more potential. over all though Opposing Force is a great expansion and I recomended it to new Half Life fans or any FPS fans aswell. My final verdict is a 10/10 Awesome Ass Game!

Another expansion pack for the original HL, this time giving us a look into the "enemy side" and the way that the events of Black Mesa affected the Marine Corps called to "contain" the situation. The main character Corporal Adrian Sherpard is brought into the facility but things dont go like planned and all hell is broken loose.
Another short game that complements the original story of Gordon Freeman, but the ending of this game leads me to believe that we might see more of this character in future installements of HL, so it might not be just an expansion pack game.

9/10.

Ce jeu est clairement un excellent DLC du premier Half Life.
Les clins d'oeil y sont présents, on peut voir Gordon freeman à plusieurs reprises ! Et bien sûr le Gman qui fait toujours ses petites affaires de son coté ;-)
Il y a de nouveaux aliens de Xen, encore meillleurs que ceux de Half Life 1 qui étaient déjà pas mal intelligents.
De bonnes armes pour tous les poutrer !
Si je recommande ? Clairement ! Foncez si vous êtes fan de Half Life !

Set during the during the events of Half-Life, the Opposing Force expansion pack offers a different perspective as you play the role of one of the soldiers sent in to supress an alien invasion.

Opposing Force builds on Half-Life's game mechanics, allowing you to command a small group of soldiers who have different attributes. You have the medic who can heal you and your allies, the engineer who can cut through inaccessable areas and your standard infantry solider who helps you during firefights. The friendly AI is quite rudimentary and you will often witness your allies wandering out into the open and getting cut down by enemies.

The enemies you face are similar to those in Half-Life but with a few interesting additions. The aliens you face are more varied as are the weapons you can use to take them down. Opposing Force features some of the most imaginative weapons you can encounter in a first person shooter, from the gun that can teleport you, or your enemies, to destinations unknown to the grenade launcher that is actually a small alien that you feed explosive food to.

Opposing Force is a great expansion pack, building on the world established in Half-Life and allowing the player to experience a familiar setting in a different light.
this is what an expansion pack should be

Je recommande car le jeu est bien fichu et change bien du 1er half life. Le style graphique reste le même mais l'histoire est assez différente et les envirronements sont différents du 1er. Si on cheat, on peut aussi refaire les niveaux de half life 1 en tant de Shepard. Le seul gros problème est l'absence totale de trousses de soins (il y en a très peux) et que les enemis semblent faire des alliances quand on arrive (les xénos, les race X et les black ops peuvent tous vous tirez dessus si ils vous voient). Le gros problème étant l'IA allié, qui a tendance à foncer dans le tas sans aucune raison et mourrir. Mais il est vraiment cool, à part la durée de vie qui est assez courte si on sait un minimum se démerder.

The first Half Life game I played before playing THE Half Life. An amazing and very interesting expansion on the world of Half Life. You play as Adrian Shepard, a Marine sent to kill Gordon Freeman and destroy Black Mesa. But on his way there, he and his Marine buddies are attacked by Xen forces, and are now stranded through out Black Mesa while looking for Gordon.

I highly recommend this game. It is a wondeful additon to the Half Life world. 

Better Weapons.
Updated Models.
Squad Based Combat.

And more importantly, more G-man sightings. 


Creepy sonofabitch.

This is how you make a good expansion pack.

While the original Half Life puts you in the role of Gordon Freeman, Opposing Force puts you in the shoes of a conpletely different character during the events of the original game. Instead of being a scientist who is trying to fight for his life, you are now Adrian Shephard, A Corporal rank soldier who, alongside his platoon, has been sent to Black Mesa to clean up the problems that have occured there.

And the mission goes to hell pretty damn fast.

What was supposes to be a simple clean up mission for Adrian suddenly becomes a similar situation that Gordon had - a fight for survival. If Adrian must endure the madness of Black Mesa, he must adapt to his surroundings, use anything he can get his hands on, rely on those willing enough to help and use his military training plus his own wit to it's full potential. So far, Opposing Force does Half Life justice by sticking with a similar story with a lot of great ideas that contrast very well with it's predecessor, so that it doesn't become too similar.

But what about the gameplay? Does it do justice to Half Life too? First off, due to the fact that you are now a Soldier instead of a Black Mesa Employee, there ane new friendly NPCs, who of which are Soldiers, Engineers, and Medics. All of which are a great help and can back each other up. And due to the way the story starts, you won't need to kill the survivors of Black Mesa (which was what the Military was sent for), the security guards and scientists of Black Mesa will still lend you a helping hand throughout the story. When it comes to weapons, sadly not all of the guns and gadgets that were in the original game make it back. However, all of the weapons that haven't made it back have been replaced with new and, surprisingly, BETTER weapons. Remember the Crowbar? You now have a stronger Combat Knife! How about the .357 Magnum? Now a Desert Eagle, which is faster and comes with a Laser sight! All the new weapons are not just replacements though, For instance, there is a new LMG weapon which is an absolute blast to use and feels completely different from the weapons that were in the original. Overall as far as weapons go, Opposing Force gives you more than just new and improved weapons. Heck I didn't even think the weapons needed to be replaced with better ones, seems what wasn't broken got fixed anyway. There are new Enemy NPC's too, and they fit very well into the Half Life Universe, such as a bigger zombie, Alien Shock Troopers and since the Military are on your side now, the enemy soldiers have been replaced with different Human enemies, I won't spoil who they are but they are a worthy replacement, seeing that they were also enemies of a different sort in the original game, now taking over another role. And the Level design is just as superb as the original, but with the inclusion of new weapons and NPCs, we get to see a load of new puzzles and situations that couldn't be done in the original game. Oh! and you can climb and swing on ropes now! Which adds to some cool things! So, as far as Gameplay goes, everything is better.

Graphically, yeah I guess it is just as blocky and wooden as the original, but there are some really varied looking levels again, even the training level looks great! The new aliens look fearsome and formiddable. Again Half Life uses real time cutscenes, which is always a treat, not to mention they are well written.

When it comes to audio again, the game sounds just as good as the original, the aliens sound angry, the guns are loud, the soundtrack is excellent and the voiceacting is superb. Soldiers now have different voice lines as well as a different voice actor  since they are now on your side, but they are a joy to hear... in a cheesy Star Fox sorta way. "MAN MY DOGS ARE BARKIN'!"

But is there anything wrong with Half Life: Opposing Force? Sadly, there are a few issues. First off, the glitch that can get you stuck in the level terrain is still present, but again it doesn't happen very often. And... as much as I hate saying it, due to the fact you can get more teammates with more aggresive firepower, the remarkable AI from the original starts to show some of it's issues. For example, Sometimes, soldiers will not realise to stop shooting when the player is in their way of the enemy target, they'll even shoot if the player hasn't walked in the way and was already standing there, if I recall. Another little nitpick I have is that friendly Medics don't heal their own wounded teammates. However, the AI is still great, especially the enemy AI, as it's still relentless as it was in the original game. My last major gripe is the end boss, although was a bit challenging, I thought it was a bit too straight forward compared to the original.

Tl;dr, Half Life: Opposing Force does justice to it's predecessor and is possibly one of the best Expansion packs I have ever had the joy of playing, and for an Expansion pack to add so much to an already perfect game is mesmarising. I may as well consider it a separate game from it's predecessor. Not only that, this was technically Gearbox Sofware's first ever project, and  considering how well made Opposing Force was, it was one hell of a way to start them off into the gaming industry. If you enjoyed Half Life, buy it. If you never played Half Life, buy it anyway!

游戏站在与戈登对立的军队方面,为玩家展现了黑山事故的另一个不为人知的秘密以及灾难.
游戏里有新的武器,新的敌人,以及99%的新场景,当然还有最最神秘的G-man.相信光是关于G-man的话题,就能讨论到下一部HL诞生.

但我觉得更多的讨论应该是集中在通过主角的冒险看到的另一个秘密,这一切主要来自于戈登和军队共同的敌人——小黑人身上.
HL三大主角有2位遇见了小黑人团体,但游戏本身却没有对他们的来历进行任何说明.通过游戏可以知道,小黑人攻击一切活动的生物,包括科学家,可见他们的目的并不是俘虏科学家而是和军队的目的一样,为了杀人灭口,但是他们却也攻击军队,说明他们的目的和军队也不一样,也就是说他们是来自一个第三方的,不以俘虏研究人员为目的,也不是想要阻止Xen星球的敌人入侵,而对于主角的敌意更像是排除遇到的麻烦.

或许这一切都只是制作者们让敌人丰富化的手段罢了,但玩家们可是很当真的.所以"BlackMesa"的制作者们就为小黑人安装了一个新的定义.
那就是小黑人的腿部安装的类似于辅助义肢的机械,和"Portal"中主角安装的机械如出一辙,因此可以大胆的推断一下,小黑人的真实身份是来自于光圈科技的特工,他们的目的就是借助黑山事故,派遣得力的小黑人们潜入黑山,窃取老对手黑山的重要研究资料,因为科学家们带着是个累赘,也有风险,所以需要被铲除,在这个时候若是遇到了戈登或者军队的人们,也会进行攻击,不过是为了排除威胁罢了.因为目标是窃取研究成果,因此等级越高的研究区域,遇见小黑人的几率也就越高,相反一心想要逃出黑山的保安则相安无事.
当局面已不受控制,或者说想要的资料都到手的时候,他们就想要引爆炸弹,来毁灭黑山的一切存在.
之后,光圈也招来了自我毁灭.而一切事件的真相就这么被错误的传播下去,正确的就只能寄希望于HL新作中为玩家们解答了.

yy了老半天,说说游戏的缺点吧.
其实并没有什么太明显的缺点,与HL相比的不足之处,在于目标的不明确性与单一性,和经历风浪,勇挑重担,最后手刃外星邪恶势力的戈登不同.这次的主角在80%的游戏进程中,有且只有一个目标——当戈登的跟屁虫,当然能从别人的视角去观察戈登的英姿是一件很快乐的事,但是见不到戈登的相当长的岁月里,心情并不是那么愉快.而当戈登去了Xen后,主角的目标就立刻来了个大转身,非要去消灭什么大虫子,这种突然的转变造成的茫然,对于一气呵成的游戏是一种硬伤啊.

Another great Half-Life game full with conflicts and such.

Pros

+ The game runs very smooth.
+ The game isn't as difficult to find your way as in the original Half-Life.
+ Rope physics!
+ Much more of a storyline then the original Half-life.
+ 272 MB.
+ Very fast loading screens.
+ The game is challenging.

Cons

- You can get stuck on everything, elevators, ropes, ladders, etc.
- No explanation on why some things happen.
- It's difficult to find healthkits in some parts.
- Strange working Night Vision.

Half-Life :Opposing Force вышел 1 ноября 1999,и является дополнением к Half-Life.
В данной ирге нам предстоит играть за солдата HECU - Андиана Шепарда,который должен устранить весь персонал ,но сам попал под атаку пришельцев.
В данной игре есть нововведения ,такие как : очки ночного видения ,что мне понравилось,новые оружия ,приспособления вроде липучки ,можно лазить по канатам,а также появились новые враги - Раса X.
Также можно увидеть Гордона Фримена ,который телепортируется в Ксен.
В этой игре много экшена,даже больше чем в оригинальном HL.

Okay, This is my favorite Half-Life mod PERIOD! It has all-new weapons, new player models, and new monsters! The only downside is NO MORE CROWBARS! :( Kinda sad because I think Half-Life is based off of crowbars crapped into zombies heads. Instead we have pipewrenches. But, they are a LOT stronger than crowbars. If you liked this review, talk to me! Username : Dr. Pepper

An awesome add on for Half Life. It gave me an interesting perspective of what the Marines felt about the whole Black Mesa incident and added some cool stuff too! It added an entire new race of aliens "Race X" as well as some new weapons and characters!

Great game, nice challenge and an interesting spectrum of enemies to keep you on your toes, however I have one complaint which seems to be a recurring theme from research on the internet, the game on steam, in particular for macs at the end, after the final boss fight, the game doesn't end and merely leaves you in the arena, very disappointing after such an impressive build up throughout the game.

I would like to see more for this game, like a part two or a remastered version.  Opposing Force could still hold its own, even without the Half-Life name attached. The story compliments the Black Mesa facility in Half-Life 1 as you play as part of the military team called in to clean up the mess.   

Pros:
   The weapons were good, having team mates as a solo player in a first person shooter  was new for its time and something you don't seen enough of.  The simple storyline for what it was; no reason to get complicated here.  Obviously the graphics are dated at this time, but it's still a good throwback. 

Cons:
   Felt like playing an obstacle course at time than a fps.

Overall 8/10 for a dated shooter, It's better than Blue Shift hands down.

За прохождение игры часто встречается фримен. Вообщем для фанатов олдскула и халвы, но я впервые поиграл в оригинальную халву в 2013 в свои 18 лет, так что годна для любого возраста.

나를풀어줘

Honestly, it IS incredible.
Now I remember HL1 when it has only come out and it was splendid. It looked so detailed back there, so long, filled with puzzles and crazy stuff.
As far as I remember, when HL Opposing Force came out, it was also praised as an awesome and one hell of an Add-on (yeah no freaking DLCs back there). I remember, I was using cheats since HL was hard (and it still is) and I simply couldn't pass through it otherwise.

Now I've finished it honestly with only my skill alone, or should I say.. Survived it. With a constant save/load, trying to stuck as much of the little HP given as possible, using up ALL of the weapons, tools and explosives given, and Honestly, after years of modern shooters with, you know Health Regen, Dumb AI that's standing still and shooting after a huge pause, linear gaming and a hell lot of ammo on round I'm voting for that era of FPS games to be back here.

Forget the graphics I was SO concentrated on the action, simply sucked into game, I really couldn't stop. For the first time in YEARS I have finally had challenge, and if you, my friend is still willing to have challenge in the one genre that puts your reflexes and aim to the test, you HAVE to fight through this game. You can either realize what it trully means an old-school way of making FPS games, or you might remind yourself of that wonderful era, when we were really proud of ourselves to get to the title in the end where you sit there relaxed and realizing it's over. No wonder modern FPS can't possibly make you feel the thrill, they don't have the guts for this.

IDK where to start well if I had to put it in some way i'd say this game honestley changed and opened up a whole new way of gaming into my life in so many ways,shapes,and forms. But honestly if you have the time or money for this then this game is definetly a good investment of your life.

Великолепное дополнение к великой игре! OP, как и BS, предоставляет нам возможность учидеть всё, что происходит в "Чёрной Мезе" с другого ракурса. 
В этом дополнении мы возьмём на себя роль одного из солдатов. Да-да, одного из тех самых солдатов, которые прибыли якобы спасти всех выживших и от которых в оригинальной игре нам досталась куча неприятностей.

В этом дополнении нас поджидают:
- новые персонажи
- новые хардкорные враги
- новые пушки
- интересные и, порой, очень сложные головоломки
- альтернативный босс

This is possibly one of the easiest games to either recommend or not recommend - it is more Half-Life. If you enjoyed Half-Life, you should get this game. If you did not enjoy Half-Life, you should not. If you have not played Half-Life, you should get and play that game first.

Simple as that.

As for the game itself, this is the greater of the two Half-Life expansion packs. It's a somewhat short side story to the original Half-Life, following the story of one of the marines who is sent in to the Black Mesa facility after everything goes to hell...err....Xen. After the initial task goes awry, he's tasked with helping to eliminate the aliens. It's a great little expansion, if a bit short, and adds new weapon types, new auxiliary features to the interface, new enemies, you get the idea. Fantastic addition to the franchise mythos.

It's an okay game.
It's days of glory are gone, so I could recommend this game only for Half-life fans, which hasn't played yet older titles.
Game engine and graphics really sucks today, but we, hardcore fans can live with that. 
Just, cooperation with NPCs (soldiers), AI, ... it is for pure older players, which played games in 1990's years and can forgive all this shit :-) Storyline is either not briliant, but makes its jobe done.
What can surprise, are few logic puzzles, which player must solve to continue. Some of them takes a few moments :-)
6/10

Je to fajn hra. Bohužiaľ, jej dni slávy už pominuli, takže túto hru po jej dohratí môžem odporučiť len skalným fanúšikom Half-Life série, ktorí nehrali staršie tituly. Grafika, umelá inteligencia spolubojovníkov, sem-tam nejaké bugy, to všetko dokopy mierne znechucuje zážitok z inak kvalitnej hry. Príbehová linka tiež nie je práve briliatná, ale človek si s ňou vystačí.
Čo môže prekvapiť, sú občasné logické hádanky a záseky, ktoré musí hráč vyriešiť, aby mohol postúpiť ďalej.
Hra pre skalných fanúšikov Half-Life.
this expasion is AMAZING
I love it! Way better than Half-Life 1! Ever wanted to kill Gordon Freeman? Well you can't... But you can try.

A very worthy sequel/expansion pack for Half-Life 1. This game is just as good if not better than the original, and is a must buy if you are a fan of the Half-Life series. This expansion includes many new and unique weapons, such as a portal launcher and an acid spitting alien pet. This expansion also shows new backstory and enemies of the Half-Life series never seen before.

Although I would call this more of a spin-off than a mod, this game has won it's awards for good reason. It puts you in exactly the same events as Half Life, sometimes even in some of the same areas as the original game (You even get a peek at Gordon Freeman himself before he enters the one-way portal to Xen). 
            I really liked this because it had the same style of combat as Half Life, but all the new weapons (Especially the fish) made it even more fun whenever you entered a major combat zone. I would definitely recommend this to any Half Life fan or even any FPS fan, as a must-purchase. Definitely worth the 5 bucks.
great game and hearty reccommend but terrible voice acting

Best expansion for Half-Life, and here's why:

- More weapons than the original HL and Blue Shift.
- A few cool new monsters (didn't really like that some areas had one type of monster).
- You play as a fucking MARINE and get to team up with other marines.
- New weapons give you new puzzles (such as the "portal" gun).
- Has a nice boot camp mission.
- Has some interesting areas that explore HL's lore.
- Overall feels like an expansion, whereas Blue Shift feels like a mission pack with no story and cool levels.
- It's a bit short, but still you get an amazing experience for your money.

9.5/10

Very good, challenging game. It's very nice to play as different perspective as you know HECU Marines were enemies of Freeman and the rest of Black Mesa personal. There are more different new NPC fighting along or against us, and there are more new weapons (M249 SAW, Spore launcher, Wrench)
Storyline is well- made, it somehow connects with original Half Life.

Это дополнение просто восхитительно! Взглянуть на Чёрную Мезу глазами военных - вот это да! Спустя столько лет Opposing Force для меня остаётся одной из любимых игр. Новое оружие, новые монстры - всё это просто шикарно! Особенно радуют те моменты, когда можно увидеть фримена или G-Mana, это добавляет игре загадочной атмосферы. Сюжет, в отличии от Half Life 1, тут гораздо интереснее. Купитв эту игру, вы не пожалеете ни копейки!
Interssante Sidestory die mir gefallen hat. Aber keine Pflicht.
Awesome game! and BTW it did not take me 15 hours to beat. I fell asleep while playing it!

Although I am a huge fan of the Half-Life series, this episode just disappointed me.
I believe it lacked the usual creativity I associate with the Half-Life games.
They could have done better. Look at Blue Shift.

AFFIRMITIVE.  OPPOSING FORCE IS A GREAT GAME.

COPY DAT.

Playing as one of those pesky marines that stood in your way throughout the original Half-Life, Opposing Force takes the player on a comparatively intense journey to once again escape the dangers of Black Mesa during the trail of destruction following in the wake of Gordon Freeman.  New weapons, new challenges and new enemies with a vastly improved appetite for destruction provide a far greater challenge in this combat orientated rendition of the Half-Life experience.

If gunning down aliens and making stuff go boom (shakalaka) was your favourite aspect of Half-Life, then get your camo on and fire up a cigar soldier; you're going to play Opposing Force.  That's an order.

OORAH.

4 subligars out of 5.

Half-Life: Opposing Force ist ein richtig geiles Add-on. Es erzählt eine gute geschichte und es spielt sich gut. Trotz des alters.
Aber ein Minuspunkt muss ich dem Spiel geben, weil man es gegen Mitte des Add-On´s mit 2 bestimmten Gengnertypen zu tuhen bekommt die mich persönlich richtig genervt haben (leider weis ich nicht mehr wie diese Aliens heißen).
Abgesehen davon kann ich es jedem Half-Life Fan empfehlen. :)

Half Lifeの追加エピソードという扱いの独立したゲーム
なのでHL1は必要ありませんが話は関連しているので本編をクリア後にプレイする方がいいです。
このゲームに関してはシステムはHL1と同じなので大した変更はありませんが、ユニークな武器や新たにロープが追加されたりしました。
特に後半でバーナクルが武器になるというのはとても面白いアイディアと思いました。
ストーリーとしてはとても魅力的でHLで登場した海兵隊の一員としてブラックメサの事件鎮圧に出撃します。
主人公は軍人なのでプレイしている感覚は特別SFチックなところはありません。
強いて言うなら敵がエイリアンというところだけです。
HL本編が気に入ったという方はとてもおすすめできる作品です。

In my opinion this is the best game in the Half-Life series (yes, it is indeed better than Half-Life 2; in all aspects except for slightly less advanced graphics and the fact that it doesn't have the gravity gun). It builds on the gameplay and setting of the original, it adds six new weapons as well as exploring the events of the Black Mesa incident from a fresh new angle that adds more intrigue, and answers some questions while raising new ones.

A worthy expansion to the original Half Life that lives up to its predecessor.  New aliens and a storyline that paralells the one in Half Life give you another perspective on what happened at Black Mesa. 

7/10
kick ass

Opposing Force is one of my favourite Half-Life games, and is an amazing addition to the first game. If you played Half-Life 1 and enjoyed it, OpFor delivers an intense, well-paced experience, and adds a lot more to the game. Playing through the Black Mesa Incident as the military is an interesting perspective, and adds to the complex lore of the Half-Life world. It leaves more questions than answers, as Half-Life games tend to do, which is a good thing. OpFor feels very different from the main game, and plays very different too. A lot of new weapons have been added, and although some are just reskinned versions of old weapons, the weapons here feel more militaristic than Gordon Freeman's patched together arsenal of stolen guns and scientific experiments. OpFor offers a lot of new content to Half-Life 1, and is an amazing experience for anyone who enjoyed the first game.
